introduction debris hot or the great
yoga Vasishta or yoga vasishta maha rama
jana as it is also called is a work of
about thirty two thousand sanskrit
couplets traditionally attributed to
Valmiki the author of srimad Ramayana it
is a dialogue between sage Vasishta and
shri rama during which advaita the
doctrine of non-duality in its pure form
of a java vada theory of non-rigid with
illustrative stories in between this
vast work was abridged some centuries
ago by a been inada pandita a Kashmiri
scholar into six thousand couplets which
go by the name of lagu yoga vasishta
this is a masterpiece in itself like the
original bread bhagavan Sri Rama
Maharishi used to refer to yoga vasishta
frequently and has even incorporated six
couplets from it into his supplement to
40 verses a further condensation of this
work was made long ago by an unknown
author into about two hundred and thirty
couplets divided into ten chapters as
yoga vasishta saara
or the essence of yoga vasishta of which
this translation is presented for the
first time by making his condensation
the author is rendered a great service
to all sadhaks
this is indeed a gold mine fit for
repeated reading and meditation from the
publisher the yoga vasishta surah

desires inwardly be free from
attachments and latent impressions do

world for burn the forest of duality
with the fire of the conviction I am the
one pure consciousness and remain happy
